required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Symbicort Maintenance and Reliever Therapy - Experience in Real Life Setting in Malaysia
clinical_study.official_title: Symbicort Maintenance And Reliever Therapy - Experience in Real Life Setting in Malaysia - SMARTER Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to evaluate the satisfaction level of patients using the Symbicort SMART approach for their asthma management.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Satisfaction With Asthma Treatment Questionnaire (SATQ) Scores From Baseline to the Mean of 3 Months and 6 Months After Patient Was Initially Treated With SMART
primary_outcome.time_frame: 6 months after each patient was initially treated with Symbicort SMART
primary_outcome.description: Difference/change in SATQ score between baseline and mean of 3 months and 6 months after SMART treatment as analysed by paired t-test. SATQ is a patient reported questionnaire which consists of 26 questions and scored to a scale of 1-7, the higher score indicating a greater level of satisfaction

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Asthma Control Questionnaire (ACQ-5) Score From Baseline to the Mean of 3 Months and 6 Months After Patient Was Initially Treated With SMART
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 months after each patient was initially treated with Symbicort SMART
secondary_outcome.description: Difference/change in ACQ-5 scores between baseline and mean of 3 months and 6 months after SMART treatment. ACQ-5 is a 5 question patient reported outcome measuring level of asthma control during the past 7 days and it is scored on scale of 0-6. 0 indicates no symptoms and 6 represents severe symptoms

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of asthma for past 6 months and treated with inhaled glucocorticosteroids for at least 3 months.
- Patients who asthma is classified as uncontrolled or partially controlled as defined by GINA 2006 guidelines.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients already on Symbicort SMART treatment.
- Patients who has respiratory tract infection 30 days before study enrolment.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: 201 patients were recruited from 10 government hospital based outpatient clinics from Dec 2007 until May 2008

group.title: Symbicort 160/4.5 Turbuhaler
group.description: Treatment with Symbicort 160/4.5 Turbuhaler 1 or 2 inhalations twice daily and when required as reliever

participants_list.participants: Number of patients who completed study

group.title: Symbicort 160/4.5 Turbuhaler

outcome.title: Change in Satisfaction With Asthma Treatment Questionnaire (SATQ) Scores From Baseline to the Mean of 3 Months and 6 Months After Patient Was Initially Treated With SMART
outcome.description: Difference/change in SATQ score between baseline and mean of 3 months and 6 months after SMART treatment as analysed by paired t-test. SATQ is a patient reported questionnaire which consists of 26 questions and scored to a scale of 1-7, the higher score indicating a greater level of satisfaction
outcome.time_frame: 6 months after each patient was initially treated with Symbicort SMART
outcome.population: 201 participants were recruited but statistical analysis was completed for 195 participants

ACQ-5 is a 5 question patient reported outcome measuring level of asthma control during the past 7 days and it is scored on scale of 0-6. 0 indicates no symptoms and 6 represents severe symptoms

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
